Decision_Outcome: Quashed, with effects stayed pending new tribunal decision
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate procedural unfairness
Legal_Rule: Administrative decisions must adhere to procedural fairness standards, including unbiased tribunal, proper notice, and right to representation
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness, depending on context
Procedural_Issue: Bias, lack of proper notice, lack of right to representation
Grounds_for_Claim: Procedural unfairness in the appeal tribunal proceedings
Judicial_Review_Outcome: Decision quashed, remitted to a new tribunal
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Found lacking due to bias, inadequate notice, and limited participation
Legal_Framework: Administrative law principles of natural justice
Applicant_Challenge: Terry Lavallée challenged the tribunal's decision based on procedural unfairness
Court_Result: Granted judicial review, ordered redetermination by new tribunal
Legal_Rule_Source: Common law principles of procedural fairness
Remedy_Requested: Quashing of decision and order for re-determination
Outcome: Decision quashed, effects stayed until new tribunal decision
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review followed by re-hearing before a new tribunal
Applicable_Process: Internal band election appeal process under self-governance
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Re-determination of election results by new tribunal
Jurisdiction: Indigenous band-level administrative tribunal, subject to Canadian administrative law
Governing_Rule: Principles of natural justice: audi alteram partem and nemo judex in causa sua
